label: Zoho Books API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the zoho-books API.

tools.name: AcceptEstimate
tools.description:
Mark a sent estimate as accepted if the customer has accepted it.

Use this tool to update the status of a sent estimate to accepted once your customer has approved it.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID for the organization related to the estimate acceptance.

parameters.name: estimate_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the estimate to be marked as accepted.

tools.name: ActivateBankAccount
tools.description:
Activate a bank account in Zoho Books.

This tool is used to mark a bank account as active in Zoho Books. It should be called when there is a need to change the status of a bank account to active.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization in Zoho Books. This ID is required to activate a bank account within the specified organization.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the bank account to be activated in Zoho Books.

tools.name: ActivateChartOfAccount
tools.description:
Activate a chart of account in Zoho Books.

Use this tool to update the status of a chart of account to active in Zoho Books. This is useful when you need to ensure an account is reactivated and available for transactions.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the organization in Zoho Books that needs the account to be activated.

parameters.name: account_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the account to be activated in Zoho Books.

tools.name: ActivateContact
tools.description:
Activate a contact in Zoho Books.

Use this tool to mark a contact as active in Zoho Books. It should be called when a contact's status needs to be changed from inactive to active.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the organization to which the contact belongs.

parameters.name: contact_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the contact to be marked as active.

tools.name: ActivateFixedAsset
tools.description:
Activate a fixed asset to begin depreciation calculation.

Use this tool to mark a fixed asset as active, which will initiate the calculation of its depreciation.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of the organization. This is required to identify which organization's asset to activate.

parameters.name: fixed_asset_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the fixed asset to activate for depreciation calculation.

tools.name: ActivateInactiveItem
tools.description:
Activate an inactive item in Zoho Books.

Use this tool to reactivate an item that has been previously marked as inactive in Zoho Books. It should be called when you need to make an item available again for transactions.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for your organization in Zoho Books. Required to activate an item.

parameters.name: item_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to be activated in Zoho Books.

tools.name: ActivateInactiveUser
tools.description:
Mark an inactive user as active.

Use this tool to activate a user who is currently marked as inactive in the system.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the organization for which the user will be reactivated. Ensure it matches the organization's records.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the user to be activated.

tools.name: ActivateInvoiceReminder
tools.description:
Enable automated payment reminders for invoices.

Activate automatic reminders for invoice payments to ensure timely settlements.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of the organization for which the invoice payment reminder is being activated.

parameters.name: invoice_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the invoice for which payment reminders are to be activated.

tools.name: ActivateLocation
tools.description:
Marks a location as active.

Use this tool to mark a specified location as active in the system. This is useful for enabling locations that were previously inactive.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of the organization to which the location belongs.

parameters.name: location_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the location to be marked as active.

tools.name: ActivateProject
tools.description:
Activate a project in Zoho Books.

This tool marks a specified project as active in Zoho Books. Call this tool when you need to change the status of a project to active to enable its functionalities or integrations.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the organization in which the project is to be activated.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the project to activate in Zoho Books.

tools.name: AddCommentToBill
tools.description:
Add a comment to a specific bill in Zoho Books.

    Use this tool to add a comment to a bill identified by its ID in Zoho Books. Useful for internal notes or communication about a bill.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization in Zoho Books. Required to specify which organization's bill to comment on.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: bill_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the bill to add a comment.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the organization for which the contact address will be added. This is required to specify the target organization in Zoho Books.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the contact to which an address will be added.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddCreditNoteComment

parameters.name: mode

parameters.name: organization_id

    This tool facilitates the creation of a new user within your organization using Zoho Books' services. It should be called when you need to register a new user in your organization's Zoho Books account.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization in Zoho Books where the user will be created.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: EmailContactStatement
tools.description:
Sends an email statement to a specified contact.

    This tool triggers an email statement to be sent to a specific contact using Zoho Books. If no JSON input is provided, the email will use default content. Use this tool when you need to send financial statements to clients or contacts.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create

tools.name: GetInvoiceList
tools.description:
Retrieve and organize a list of invoices from Zoho Books.

This tool fetches a list of invoices using Zoho Books' API with options for pagination, filtering, searching, and sorting. Useful for finding specific invoices or browsing records systematically.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization for which invoices are being queried. This ID is crucial for accessing the correct set of invoices within Zoho Books.

parameters.name: search_by_invoice_number
parameters.description: Search for invoices using their unique invoice number. Supports 'startswith' and 'contains' variants. Max length: 100 characters.

parameters.name: search_invoice_by_item_name
parameters.description: Filters invoices by product or service name in line items. Supports 'item_name_startswith' and 'item_name_contains'. Max length: 100 characters.

parameters.name: search_by_item_id
parameters.description: Search invoices by item ID. Use the unique identifier of a product or service to filter invoices that include specific line items.

parameters.name: item_description_filter
parameters.description: Filter invoices by item description using keywords. Supports 'startswith' and 'contains' variants. Max 100 characters.

parameters.name: search_reference_number
parameters.description: Search invoices by reference number, such as purchase order or project codes, to find invoices associated with specific projects or transactions.

parameters.name: search_by_customer_name
parameters.description: Search for invoices using the customer's name, with a maximum length of 100 characters, to generate customer-specific reports or find all invoices for a customer.

parameters.name: recurring_invoice_id
parameters.description: ID of the recurring invoice from which the invoice is created. Use to filter invoices tied to specific recurring billing cycles.

parameters.name: customer_email_filter
parameters.description: Filter invoices by the customer's email address. Maximum length is 100 characters. Ideal for finding specific customer invoices or customer segment analysis.

parameters.name: search_by_total_amount
parameters.description: Search and filter invoices based on the final total amount, including taxes, discounts, and adjustments. Useful for finding invoices within specific price ranges or identifying high-value transactions.

parameters.name: search_by_outstanding_balance
parameters.description: Filter invoices by outstanding balance to find overdue invoices, track receivables, or generate aging reports.

parameters.name: search_by_custom_field
parameters.description: Search invoices using custom fields. Supports 'custom_field_startswith' and 'custom_field_contains' for partial matching.

parameters.name: invoice_date_filter
parameters.description: Filter invoices by invoice date using yyyy-mm-dd format. Supports variants like date_start, date_end, date_before, and date_after to find invoices within specific date ranges.

parameters.name: invoice_due_date_filter
parameters.description: Filter invoices by due date using yyyy-mm-dd format. Supports start, end, before, and after variants for flexible searching.

parameters.name: filter_by_creation_date
parameters.description: Filter invoices by creation date with yyyy-mm-dd format. Supports variants: start, end, before, and after.

parameters.name: filter_by_last_modified_time
parameters.description: Filters invoices modified after a specific timestamp in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS-UTC format. Useful for identifying recently updated invoices.

parameters.name: invoice_status
parameters.description: Filter invoices by their current status (e.g., sent, draft, overdue, etc.).

parameters.name: search_by_customer_id
parameters.description: Filters invoices using the unique customer ID. Use the ID from the Contacts API to find all invoices for a specific customer.

parameters.name: filter_invoices_by_criteria
parameters.description: Filter invoices by status (e.g., Status.Sent, Status.Paid) or payment expected date using Date.PaymentExpectedDate.

parameters.name: general_search_text
parameters.description: General search for invoices by invoice number, purchase order, or customer name. Accepts up to 100 characters.

parameters.name: sort_by_column
parameters.description: Specify the column to sort invoices by. Options: customer_name, invoice_number, date, due_date, total, balance, created_time.

parameters.name: search_by_crm_potential_id
parameters.description: Find invoices linked to a specific CRM deal or opportunity using its potential ID from Zoho CRM.

parameters.name: response_format_type
parameters.description: Specifies the desired response format: 0 for all invoices, 1 for all invoices with counts and totals, 2 for count only, 3 for count and totals, 4 for invoices and totals.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Page number to fetch from paginated results. Default is 1. Use with 'per_page' for navigating large data sets.

parameters.name: records_per_page
parameters.description: Number of records to fetch per page. Default is 200, maximum is 200. Use to control result size for performance optimization.

tools.name: ImportBankStatements
tools.description:
Import bank or credit card feeds into your account.

    Use this tool to import bank or credit card statements directly into your account for seamless financial management. This should be called when you need to process new bank or credit card data into the system.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of the organization to import bank statements for.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

Import a product from Zoho CRM to Zoho Books.

parameters.name: crm_product_id

Import a customer from Zoho CRM to Zoho Books using CRM account ID.

parameters.name: crm_account_id

parameters.name: zoho_crm_vendor_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Zoho CRM vendor to import.

tools.name: InviteUserToProject
tools.description:
Invite a user to a project in Zoho Books.

    Use this tool to send an invitation to a user to join a specific project in Zoho Books. This is helpful when you need to collaborate with others by adding them to project teams.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization in Zoho Books where the project is located.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: project_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the project in Zoho Books.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: ListAccountTransactions
tools.description:
Retrieve transactions for a specified account.

Use this tool to list all transactions associated with a given account. Ideal for tracking financial activities related to specific accounts.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization whose account transactions are being queried.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the account to retrieve transactions for.

parameters.name: transaction_date_range
parameters.description: Specify a date range for searching transactions. Use 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. Supports 'date.start', 'date.end', 'date.before', and 'date.after'.

parameters.name: amount_range
parameters.description: Specify the amount range to filter account transactions. Use fields like less_than, less_equals, greater_than, and greater_equals to define the criteria.

parameters.name: filter_by_account_type
parameters.description: Filter accounts based on account type and status. Options: AccountType.All, AccountType.Active, AccountType.Inactive, AccountType.Asset, AccountType.Liability, AccountType.Equity, AccountType.Income, AccountType.Expense.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description: Filter transactions by type, such as 'invoice', 'expense', or 'refund'.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Specify the column to sort transactions. Possible values: 'account_name', 'account_type'.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Page number to be fetched for the transaction list. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

parameters.name: records_per_page
parameters.description: Number of records to be fetched per page. Default is 200. Specify a custom integer to override.

tools.name: ListActiveInventoryItems
tools.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all active inventory items.

Use this tool to fetch a list of all active items from the inventory. It provides the data with pagination to manage large sets of items efficiently.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization to fetch items from.

parameters.name: item_name_search
parameters.description: Search for items by name using prefixes 'name_startswith' or 'name_contains'. Maximum length is 100 characters.

parameters.name: description_filter
parameters.description: Search items by description. Use keywords or phrases up to 100 characters. Prefix with 'description_startswith' or 'description_contains' for specific filtering.

parameters.name: search_by_rate_criteria
parameters.description: Specify rate conditions to filter items. Use format like 'rate_less_than:100'.

parameters.name: search_by_tax_id
parameters.description: Search for items using the tax ID as a filter.

parameters.name: tax_name_filter
parameters.description: Filter items by their tax name.

parameters.name: tax_exemption_identifier
parameters.description: ID for the tax exemption. Required if is_taxable is false.

parameters.name: associated_account_id
parameters.description: ID of the account to associate the item with.

parameters.name: filter_items_by_status
parameters.description: Filter items by status. Allowed values are 'Status.All', 'Status.Active', and 'Status.Inactive'.

parameters.name: search_items_by_text
parameters.description: Search for items by name or description, up to 100 characters.

parameters.name: sort_items_by
parameters.description: Specify the attribute to sort items by. Allowed values: 'name', 'rate', 'tax_name'.

parameters.name: sat_item_key_code
parameters.description: SAT Item key code used to filter items. Provide a valid string key code for lookup.

parameters.name: sat_unit_code
parameters.description: SAT Unit code for specific inventory items. Used to search or filter items based on their unit code.

parameters.name: page_number_to_fetch
parameters.description: The page number of active items to retrieve, with a default of 1 if unspecified.

parameters.name: records_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default is 200.

parameters.name: is_item_taxable
parameters.description: Boolean indicating if the item is taxable. True means the item is taxable.

tools.name: ListAllBills
tools.description:
Retrieve all bills with pagination support.

This tool is used to list all bills available in the system, providing pagination information to navigate through large datasets. It should be called whenever there's a need to view or analyze billing details over multiple pages.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization. Required to specify which organization's bills to list.

parameters.name: filter_by_bill_number
parameters.description: Filter bills using the bill number. Use exact matches, prefix with 'bill_number_startswith', or substring with 'bill_number_contains'.

parameters.name: filter_by_reference_number
parameters.description: Filter bills by reference number. Supports exact matches, prefix matching using `reference_number_startswith`, and substring matching using `reference_number_contains`. Useful for finding bills by external references or vendor invoice numbers.

parameters.name: bill_date_filter
parameters.description: Filter bills by bill date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Use for specific dates, date ranges (date_start/date_end), or relative dates (date_before/date_after).

parameters.name: filter_by_status
parameters.description: Specify the status of bills to filter by. Options include 'paid', 'open', 'overdue', 'void', or 'partially_paid'.

parameters.name: filter_by_description_text
parameters.description: Filter bills using description text. Supports exact matches, prefix matching with 'description_startswith', or substring matching with 'description_contains'. Useful for finding bills by line item descriptions or vendor notes.

parameters.name: filter_by_vendor_name
parameters.description: Filter bills by vendor name. Use prefix matching with 'vendor_name_startswith' or substring matching with 'vendor_name_contains'.

parameters.name: filter_by_total_amount
parameters.description: Filter bills by total amount using conditions like less than, greater than, etc. Specify conditions using keys like 'total_less_than' or 'total_greater_than'.

parameters.name: filter_by_vendor_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier to filter bills by a specific vendor, retrieving all related bills.

parameters.name: filter_by_item_id
parameters.description: Filter bills by a specific item ID. Retrieves all bills containing a particular product or service item based on its unique identifier.

parameters.name: recurring_bill_identifier
parameters.description: Filter bills by a specific recurring bill ID to retrieve all bills generated from a recurring template or schedule.

parameters.name: filter_by_purchase_order_id
parameters.description: Specify the Purchase Order ID to filter bills associated with a specific order. Helps track procurement workflows.

parameters.name: filter_by_last_modified_time
parameters.description: Filter bills by last modification timestamp using ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+/-HHMM) to find bills modified at or after a specific time.

parameters.name: bill_status_filter
parameters.description: Filter bills by status. Options: Status.All, Status.PartiallyPaid, Status.Paid, Status.Overdue, Status.Void, Status.Open.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: Filter bills using general text across bill number, reference number, and vendor name to find matches. Useful for quick searches.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Specify the page number for pagination to navigate multiple pages of bills.

parameters.name: bills_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of bills to retrieve per page. Default is 200, but adjustable for performance needs and rate limits.

parameters.name: sort_by_column
parameters.description: Specify the column to sort bills by. Available options: vendor_name, bill_number, date, due_date, total, balance, created_time.

parameters.name: sorting_order
parameters.description: Specify the sort order for bills: 'A' for ascending, 'D' for descending.

    Use this tool to update details of a refunded vendor credit transaction by specifying the vendor credit ID and refund ID.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. This is needed to specify which organization the vendor credit refund update applies to.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: vendor_credit_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the vendor credit to be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: vendor_credit_refund_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the vendor credit refund transaction that needs to be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateVendorPayment
tools.description:

    Use this tool to update an existing vendor payment, including modifying the amount applied to bills.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:

      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: Provide the specific ID of the organization for which the vendor payment is being updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: payment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the vendor payment to be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateVendorPaymentRefund
tools.description:
Update the refunded transaction for a vendor payment.

    Call this tool to update details related to a vendor payment refund. It is used when modifications to an existing refund transaction are necessary.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization associated with the refund transaction.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: payment_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment. Required to specify which payment is being updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: vendor_payment_refund_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the vendor payment refund required for updating the transaction.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateVendorPaymentWithCustomId
tools.description:
Update or create a vendor payment using a unique custom field.

    This tool updates an existing vendor payment by using a unique custom field as an identifier. If the unique value is not found and the X-Upsert option is enabled, it will create a new vendor payment if sufficient details are provided.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization within Zoho Books.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: custom_field_api_name
parameters.description: The API name of the unique custom field used to identify the vendor payment.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: custom_field_unique_value
parameters.description: The unique value of the custom field used to identify or create a vendor payment.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: create_new_record_if_not_exists
parameters.description: Set to true to create a new vendor payment if no existing record matches the unique custom field value.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: VoidInvoiceStatus
tools.description:
Mark an invoice as void in Zoho Books.

Use this tool to change the status of an invoice to void in Zoho Books. This process will unassociate any payments and credits, placing them under customer credits.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the organization in Zoho Books. Required to specify which organization the invoice belongs to.

parameters.name: invoice_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the invoice to be marked as void.

tools.name: VoidRetainerInvoice
tools.description:
Mark a retainer invoice as void.

This tool marks a specified retainer invoice as void, disassociating any payments and credits and moving them under customer credits.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of the organization required to identify which organization's invoice to void.

parameters.name: retainer_invoice_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the retainer invoice to be marked as void.

tools.name: WriteOffFixedAsset
tools.description:
Remove a fixed asset from the records.

    Use this tool to write off a fixed asset. It should be called when an asset needs to be removed from the records in Zoho Books.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization. Required to specify which organization's asset is to be written off.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: fixed_asset_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the fixed asset to be written off in Zoho Books.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: WriteOffInvoiceBalance
tools.description:
Write off the balance amount of an invoice in Zoho Books.

Use this tool to write off the remaining balance of an invoice in Zoho Books when the amount is uncollectible.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the organization in Zoho Books.

parameters.name: invoice_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the invoice to be written off.
